extendedMetadata.name: Objective
extendedMetadata.value: LO: 5.4: Why did it take eight years of warfare for the Americans to gain independence?

subject: US History
metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: FA Understand 05 05

config.question: Which of the following elements helped to weaken Britain’s logistical advantages over the Americans?

choices.content: the fact that most American officers were battlefield veterans
Washington’s decision to build a guerilla army
America’s population, which was about four times that of Britain’s
the depth of the Americans’ commitment to a political ideology

answer_3.response: Consider This: Unlike the European troops before the French Revolution, who served in the military because they were paid or because the military was a vocation, the American troops had a remarkable commitment to republican ideals. One French officer reported from the United States, “It is incredible that soldiers composed of men of every age, even of children of fifteen, of whites and blacks, almost naked, unpaid, and rather poorly fed, can march so well and withstand fire so steadfastly.” See L.O. 5.4 Why did it take eight years of warfare for the Americans to gain independence?
